thread.title: Friday Night Lights (Thursday Edition)

author: Gazette Staff
title: Friday Night Lights (Thursday Edition)
text:
A host of Billings Central Rams attempt to bring down a Sidney runner Saturday. Friday Night Lights (Thursday Edition) Gazette Staff 
A host of Billings Central Rams attempt to bring down a Sidney runner Saturday. 
Thursday, October 15 
Missoula Big Sky (1-6) at Billings Skyview (1-6), 7 p.m, Wendy's Field at Daylis Stadium 
Skyview played three quarterbacks in a 34-7 loss to Billings West last week. Drew Keierleber, who finished with 102 yards on 20 carries, finished the game as the Falcons' signal caller. ... Big Sky picked up its first win of the year, downing crosstown rival Missoula Hellgate (0-7) 34-6. 
Billings West (4-3) at Missoula Sentinel (4-3), 7 p.m. 
Both teams are in the hunt for a Class AA playoff spot. ... The game will be played at Washington-Grizzly Stadium. ... West has won four in a row. ... Senior Josh Deshner scored three touchdowns, including two interception returns, for Sentinel in a 41-18 win over Great Falls. 
Friday, October 16 
Great Falls CMR (4-3) at Billings Senior (6-1), 7 p.m., Wendy's Field at Daylis Stadium 
The Broncs, who lost their first game 20-19 to Bozeman last week, can clinch a playoff berth with a win. ... QB Nate Dick scored twice on runs and had a passing TD for the Broncs last week. ... It is the Rustlers' third trip to Billings. CMR downed West 42-33 in the second week and topped Skyview 50-28 in Week Four. 
Billings Central (3-0, 5-1) at Miles City (3-0, 7-0), 7 p.m. 
The game will likely decide the Eastern A division title. ... Miles City traveled to Laurel and won 34-14 last week as Matthew Blunt threw for two touchdowns and ran for another. ... Central won its homecoming game 46-22 over Sidney for its fourth straight victory. In that span, the Rams have scored 204 points and allowed 22. 
Hardin (0-3, 1-5) at Laurel (1-2, 4-2), 7 p.m. 
Both teams are coming off losses; Miles City beat Laurel 34-14 and Glendive topped Hardin 20-13. ... Casey Cole passed for one TD and ran for another for the Locomotives. ... Connor Murdock and Codi Small notched scoring runs for the Bulldogs. Tags
